meanings.definition: Having an abnormal outward curvature of the spine.
meanings.sent1: The kyphotic posture of the old man made it hard for him to stand straight.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with a kyphotic spine after the examination.
meanings.sent3: The kyphotic cat tried to arch its back even more when it saw a bird outside.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range looked kyphotic against the horizon, bending gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The tree's trunk twisted in a kyphotic manner, creating a unique shape.

meanings.definition: A person or animal with a hump in the upper back.
meanings.sent1: The kyphotic camel walked proudly through the desert.
meanings.sent2: The zoo had a special enclosure for the kyphotic elephant with the hump.
meanings.sent3: The kyphotic turtle struggled to fit in its shell comfortably.
meanings.sent4: The old dog's kyphotic back didn't stop him from wagging his tail happily.
meanings.sent5: The kyphotic buffalo stood out among the herd with its distinctive shape.

meanings.definition: The condition of having a rounded back.
meanings.sent1: The kyphotic of the office worker was noticeable as he sat at his desk.
meanings.sent2: The ballet teacher corrected the student's posture to avoid developing a kyphotic.
meanings.sent3: The kyphotic of the penguin made it waddle in a funny way.
meanings.sent4: The clouds formed a kyphotic shape in the sky, resembling a giant hump.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a kyphotic figure in the background of the portrait.
